review_text: Nice hydrating foundation. A thin layer goes a long way, you can build it up but I feel it looks best applied really thinly with a brush. i have tried it with a beauty blender and it felt too heavy on my face. As someone with combination skin I do find I have to set with a loose powder in the oiler areas of my face. I use milk hydro grip underneath and set with Laura Mercier loose powder and urban decay all nighter spray. It doesn't move and doesn't separate all day. One thing to keep in mind when choosing your shade; it DOES OXIDIZE, at least on MY skin, I know everyone has different skin chemistry, so this may not be the case for everyone. I ended up going back and buying a shade lighter than what I first bought. I would recommend swatching on your neck or hand and shop around 20 min or so and see if the colour will oxidize on you too. Other than the oxidizing thing I really love it. It's pricey... but honestly one bottle lasts literally forever.
As someone who does not wear makeup often, this foundation is very easy to apply and blend. Provides moderate dewy coverage.

I love this foundation so much!! I struggle to find nice foundations and have spent way too much money. It is beautiful, natural looking and a little goes a long way! The only downside is that the shades are tough to match. I would say I have light to medium skin, but this shade was even too dark for me. I am like a shade 2 lol! It also does oxidize so will turn a bit darker after you apply. I would just test out the shades. Love the foundation though and it doesn‚Äôt make my combo skin break out or anything. Also has pretty clean ingredients. Love it!!
Really good Dior hydration foundation but it‚Äôs not matching my skin tone
Beat foundation ever pricey but worth it. Will continue to buy it.
they sold items used before never buy online items again

I was colour matched in the store, but I thought it smelt funny when she was putting it on. I bought one anyways and took it home only to pull it out that evening and see it has been expired for over a year. My skin is already breaking out from having it on my skin from the store. Not to mention it clings to any fine lines.

WOW.  Great coverage but doesn't look "cakey" at all.  A little goes a long long way.  Love the hydrating too.  I usually can't wait to finish work and take  makeup off.Not now.  Great long wear and stays fresh looking.This is so my new foundation.As usual CD didn't disappoint. All makeup I now use is Dior.  Totally boss.

I think I may have found my holy grail foundation! It was a long struggle as I was deciding between lancome teint idol, dior forever skin glow/matte or haus lab foundation.  I first bought lancome, it was alright but I wasn't loving it and for the price I should be loving it, so I went back and exchanged it for dior. 

I usually go for matte cause i like a soft blur effect (especially around the pores).  Although I always wanted a radiant finish too, I was worried it would look oily or emphasize my texture and pores. However, based on my various research (youtube video), many reported the matte and skin glow version bring similar with slight difference in finish. With the weather getting colder, i do want my skin to be more hydrated, so i got skin glow, and im loving it. It has a slight satin effect at first, especially with powder. The glow becomes more apparent over time, but it won't look oily but actually more skin like with a healthy hydrated look. It's still transfer proof and longevity it good too. By the 9h work, it started to separate but only a little, and it's very easy to fix up without it affecting the rest of the face.

I actually compared it with haus lab (i got a sample) cause I heard great things about it, and i really love how haus lab looked on my hand when I was swatch both in the store. It was smoother and more radiant than dior but also seems it would transfer more. When trying both on with powder, the transfer is no longer an issue. Interestingly, at first, haus lab looked more radiant AND powdery than dior, which looks soft and skin like. But after a while, both looked skin like but haus lab did settle into my pores a bit more. It also doesn't last as long as dior, since it started breaking apart around the 7h mark, but like dior it's easy to fix up without it affecting rest of the face.

Absolutely loving it. It gives such a smooth and satin finish, gives decent coverage without being cakey at all. I have normal to dry skin, and this does not oxidize on me. I find it to be the same shade after many hours. I will say try the shade in store though because I usually use warm, but this foundation I use neutral. Shout out to Paula for helping me shade match.

My skin is dry so it's difficult to me to find a foundation which not make it's cakey. One of the staff showed me this foundation 3 years ago and I just keep using it until now. I don't need to use powder but itself keep long on my face

Best foundation ever! The color is perfect, leaves no steaks, blends in wonderfully! 
Smells great too

This foundation is the best I‚Äôve tried so far. For DRY SKIN, this is excellent. It‚Äôs super hydrating and I swear it makes your skin look more radiant after each use. It‚Äôs like skincare + makeup, it‚Äôs amazing!!!

The Dior Forever Skin Foundation was a disappointment. It felt overly oily on my skin, oxidized significantly throughout the day, and the strong fragrance irritated my sensitive skin, leading to breakouts. Not suitable for
Worn this a couple times but noticed it left my face really oil and caused breakouts. This foundation oxidizes.
This foundation blends perfectly and makes your skin hydrated!
Went on smoothly and had a beautiful, gentle, glowy finish. But I don't have a shade.  00N is too yellow and too light.  0CR is too deep.
I literally tried so many foundation but this is best the best foundation ,, i am glad that i found my correct shade , it is very dewy ,long lasting . I love to recommend this .

i‚Äôve been using this for about a month, and i hate to say it but it‚Äôs my new fave foundation! the ONE thing i hate about this is the fragrance in it (literally what is the point of FRAGRANCE in a FOUNDATION?) i have VERY acne prone/textured skin and i haven‚Äôt noticed any extra texture since using this, but i would be cautious if you‚Äôre sensitive to fragrance on skin. in terms of coverage, i would say it‚Äôs medium, but can be built up. i was originally really worried because im on arazlo, and every single foundation/tint i‚Äôve used since starting it literally PEELS off my face after like an hour, but this foundation looks soooo smooth on my skin, and holds up until the end of my shifts! so far the only foundations to work on my skin since arazlo are this one and the lanc√¥me glow foundation. overall, just a really nice foundation that sits so nicely on my TEXTURED skin!!

BOMB BOMB BOMB I am obsessed. Perfect balance between sheer and medium coverage. Depending on how I feel and the look I want that day, I often just wear this as my base after moisturizer and primer and then add a little more under my eyes and-boom, perfect. Not only does it FEEL light, it hydrates dull skin without leaving a greasy film. My skin looks radiant and Dior Forever Skin Glow Hydrating Foundation has become a STAPLE in my makeup routine. 

OH BUT BEWARE ‚Äî TEST THESE SHADES IN PERSON AT A STORE. Their naming system is very off (at least I found it to be). 

For some background, I have always been neutral toned, I have both green and blue veins in my arms and am a darn-near greenish yellow-olive undertone to my skin and go brown in the summer (no red, no pink, just golden brown). I spent over an HOUR testing all the different shades and tones and finally came to 0W. It is my EXACT match right now, however, it‚Äôll be a different story when my skin sees the sun. Highly highly recommend going IN STORE and trying all of the shades because I never would have guessed I‚Äôd be ‚Äúwarm‚Äù.

I'm in my mid forties and I really like this.  I don't need full coverage so medium coverage is good for me.  Keeps my skin looking hydrated, lasts all day, and looks amazing.  I need only one pump which is a small amount but it does the job.

Used to rave about this foundation even though It oxidizes, I loved It, just knew to get a shade lighter. Until It started to give me the WORST texture bumps everywhere because of the fragrance In It.

Best foundation, gives such a natural glow. The coverage is perfect, I have a little scar I usually test foundation over to see if it can give me the coverage and if I apply it a few times in that area it definitely does. I even returned my ester lauder double wear for this and I‚Äôll never go back.

This foundation DOES oxidize - but it‚Äôs my absolute favourite foundation. I‚Äôm a true combo skin girly, and during the winter get eczema under my eyes. It feels great on my skin and doesn‚Äôt look heavy even when you build it up to super full coverage, on a day to day I can achieve a light to medium coverage with it and it lasts the whole day. 

It isn‚Äôt transfer-proof but the way my skin looks and feels so healthy and glowy but not oily is perfect. There‚Äôs no weird clinging to dry patches, or separation due to oil. I really enjoy this foundation and highly recommend it just keep in mind it does oxidize when you‚Äôre shade matching!
My bad, I tried the hydrating one but it is too shiny and it transfers a lot. The coverage is good though.
Natural, lightweight, mid to high coverage. She is THAT girl, she is the moment. I don‚Äôt even feel it on my skin, yet it is sooo beautiful ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞. The glass packaging is slick and elegant.
It‚Äôs ok! I found it wasn‚Äôt as hydrating at others as well as it settles and shows pores. I am mixing it now with my Givenchy and like it that way for more flawless/skin like effect
I bought this for the first time cuz the brand i was using was out of stock, and I found this one is even better than the one i was using

I was going to try this after seeing many wonderful reviews here and on Youtube. OMG people, the SECOND ingredient after water is ALCOHOL. And Dior has the gall to call this a ‚Äúclean product‚Äù. Alcohol causes skin cell death. It is a very destructive ingredient for skin. And it is the second most abundant ingredient in this foundation. No way am I going to put this swill on my face.
long-lasting and resistant to heat and humidity, making it ideal for all-day wear.
Not 100% a fan. Hydration is definitely there. Just not a fan of how easily if transfers to fabric or even my hands.

I bought this from the store yesterday. I didn‚Äôt check the packaging there when I came home I noticed the product doesn‚Äôt come out like it doesn‚Äôt pump. Really disappointed and I live pretty far from sephora location its not worthto go back and exchange
Mon fonds de teint pr√©f√©r√©. J'ai une peau s√®che et sensible et ce fond de teint rend ma peau unifi√©e et hydrat√©e.

I bought the dior foundation recently because I was trying to find similar one to Armani beauty. This one does feel like skin, i tried it and no creasing! I have combination to dry skin and it didn‚Äôt feel too greasy. It just felt like I had a nice glow. It didn‚Äôt oxidize either which is a plus. Overall I love this foundation and I‚Äôm so glad I bought it! Hopefully it wont dry me out for winter:)
My favorite fondation: leaves your skin flawless and glowy. The only reason i am not giving 5 stars is because of the smell‚Ä¶the perfum smell is too strong ü•≤

This is one of the best liquid foundation I‚Äôve used. Never oxidized and color stay true for the whole day. It‚Äôs hydrating and glow just enough without looking shiny or oily. For those with cool undertones, I feel that the CR version is still slightly warm, so make sure you test the samples before purchasing it.
The shade match is almost impossible to get right. Oxidized and left dry patches on my skin.

I have de hydrated skin I need all the glow I can get. I‚Äôm so happy that the lady at Sephora recommended this foundation and I‚Äôm in love with it. It‚Äôs glowy light to medium coverage. Will re purchase in my winter shade
All the CR and Neutral shades from this collection pulled yellow / orangey on my complexion. Until I discovered the shade 3C, it‚Äôs perfect for olive complexions. 3C & 3CR are not the same.

A solid like. I don‚Äôt get the ‚Äòglow‚Äô or the ‚Äòhydrating‚Äô indicated but it‚Äôs definitely not matte. My coverage preference is light to light-medium coverage though I purchased knowing this was a medium to full coverage so I have that option but could sheer it out using a sponge. Overall it‚Äôs just a like for me. I prefer the Backstage.
This has really good coverage and it lasts me the whole day

I‚Äòve used many foundations throughout my years but this foundation, by far, exceeds all others for a woman who has not had any injections & does not use filters. This is very hydra for harsh winters. I can‚Äôt wait to purchase the matte formula for summertime.

I love this foundation so much. First of all, 00N is a perfect shade match for my ultra fair, neutral-cool skin and it does not oxidize on me. It's fuller coverage but still looks like skin and has a beautiful, radiant finish. I stopped using foundation while we were all masking up during the pandemic, but have since started using it again as of Winter 2023. My skin looks beautiful, even on a bad skin day, and I just purchased my second bottle.

The product goes on really nicely and has a lovely finish. The problem for me is that 0CR still has a yellow undertone even though it's supposed to have a cool undertone. As a result it's too yellow and dark for my pinkish pale skin. There's also a very heavy perfume smell to the product.
You don‚Äôt need anything except moisturizer to prep your skin before foundation, this foundation has everything in it, skin feels hydrated, gives you extraordinary glow without leaving it oily.
This foundation is among the best I have used, easy to apply, offers medium coverage and settles in nicely.

At last, a foundation that doesn‚Äôt oxidize orange on my sickly Victorian white skin!!! Great looking coverage, takes to my skin perfectly. I love the scent, the glow, the coverage. My foundation search is over, this is the one!
This is the only foundation that does not flake on my dry eczema prone skin!!! It also has skincare benifits which give suit that glowy skin. Not heavy as well!
First of all it has fragrance that i don‚Äôt like on my face. Secondly it does oxidise and look 2-3 shade darker . It look too orange after some time . Its a big no for me .

It blends very easily. I just love it. It stays for long and it doesn't separate or look cakey. It's very important to prepare your skin before you apply it. If you use it after ‚ÄúStar filter‚Äù from Dior it's gonna be and look amazing.
This is by far the best foundation I have ever purchased - it looks like skin and you can build it up or wear it very light. Just make sure you know it‚Äôs a water based foundation

Ive tried over 10 glowy foundations and this is my go to. Lightweight, glowy but not oily, lasts all day. I had a super busy day, wore it from 830am to midnight. My skin still looked flawless. No primer just CT setting spray. This is one of those base products that just melds with your natural face oils and works so well with your other makeup products that it looks better as the day wears on. A must have for mature skin, I am 42 and this just makes you look so smooth and does not highlight imperfections
It matches my skin tone !!!! I look like I have no make up at all

I've tried so many different foundations before, and this has been the best one I've tried! It feels light weight on my skin and gives me a natural, airbrushed look. I would definitely recommend this foundation to anyone!

Tried multiple shades of this foundation but no luck. 0CR was far too light, then tried 1CR and it was orange on me. I love the formula but unfortunately can't find a shade to match. Also has a very strong fragrance.
The formula is so light and has good coverage. The shade for my skin tone is perfect! Love it.

SUPER STRONG FRAGRANCE. Like rubbing perfume on your face. Other than that, the foundation oxidized a little weird on my skin and it broke apart in the T zone. After a few hours it settled into fine lines. Overall, not worth the price.

Although I asked for a shade match, this shade looked green on me, I also had to use a lot of product to get the coverage that I wanted. The fragrance was very overwhelming and it started to settle into my fine lines.

I have been using Dior Forever Skin Glow for over a year now. I have normal-dry, sensitive skin and have struggled for years to find a foundation I really like. So far this has been the best! Feels great on my skin and wears really nice throughout the day. I would definitely recommend it.

This foundation is gorgeous on the skin and the colour match is just perfect but it broke me out in a matter of hours. Sure, I have sensitive skin and occasionally  get acne, but this was something else. My skin was inflamed and it was just awful. Honestly, I'm sure I could find much better elsewhere at a reasonable price.
Pricey but worth it. Such a light-layer foundation that you forget you're wearing it.

Having heard so many lovely things about this foundation, I was very eager to try it.  I was however Highly disappointed in the lack of inclusivity in the shade range .. there were some shades in warm olive but only till 3WO‚Ä¶. It would have been nice to extend that further into the darker colours.
My favourite foundation. Perfect smooth/ glowy finish. Medium coverage, blurs redness & discolouration. Great for acne prone skinÔøº.
Definitely thought I would like but didn‚Äôt do much for me.

I was desperately seeking a buildable, hydrating, long-lasting, low maintenance foundation that works well with my skin. I‚Äôve been searching for my perfect foundation for years.. 

I have very dry skin, with lots of natural smile creases around my eyes. Even the best setting powders crease on me.

With this foundation, I only have to use the tiniest amount to reach my desired coverage! It doesn‚Äôt cling to any of my dry patches, or settle in to creases or scars. The glow is amazing (no shimmer at all) just healthy glow that lasts all day. Photo taken in office lighting.
Makes your skin glow! it smells amazing and has spf in it. Perfect amount of coverage for a more natural look.
Absolutely loved this foundation! It keeps the skin looking  hydrated with its skincare factor while giving a glowy finish.
I wanted to love this. I gave it a try and now that I am wearing it today after a few days or no makeup, I can see that it‚Äôs the wrong shade and the foundation settles into my pores and wrinkles.
My favourite foundation! Has a beautiful dewy glow. Coverage is great. Buildable. Stays on all day. I will keep buying this one. Highly recommend

This made my skin sooooooooo oily. Like, it wasn‚Äôt a dewy finish, it was like I had olive oil on my face. My face felt slimy. If I even lightly brushed my face, a whole layer of my makeup would wipe off (even though I used setting powder and spray). It slipped off my skin on my nose, around my mouth and on my forehead, and it clumped around my nose. This really did not work on my skin.

Medium coverage foundation that sits beautifully on my skin. It‚Äôs lightweight and gives my dry skin a dewy finish.  It‚Äôs my go-to foundation as it‚Äôs a perfect match for me and I can easily apply it with my fingertips!

The foundation itself is okay - although I think due to my more sensitive skin it felt a little drying.  It has a strong fragrance added which wasn't what I was looking for in my foundation. Overall it covers well and likely is a good product if you don't have sensitive skin like me:)
It looked great on my face but it has fragrance. My eyes started burning shortly after I put it on yesterday. Today the skin around my eyes is red, swollen and it still stings.

This foundation looks beautiful and is pretty long lasting. I give it a very light set with the Makeup Forever Twist powder on the Centre of the face and Charlotte tilbury airbrush setting powder 
everywhere else. It give you the juiciest glow and 
blurs out skin texture like a filter; my skin looked so beautiful. Only issue is it oxidized like crazy, and for a neutral shade it went quite peachy ): I would suggest to buy a shade lighter than your skin tone. It also clinged to dry spots where I have eczema but overall beautiful finish
I‚Äôve used other foundations over the past few years and have ended up with break outs or irritated skin. I should have never strayed from this Dior formula, it‚Äôs truly my must have foundation!
Beautiful finish for the first hr then skin starts to feel tight and dehydrated in the middle of a hot summer. Also gave me bumps due to the dryness i guess. Wouldn't recommend.
This is one of my favourite foundations. Makes skin look so smooth and it‚Äôs so beautiful!!

Beautiful finish but feels tight and drying on my combination skin type face in the middle of summer.  Sensitive skin people also should be aware cause of the hight alcohol content and strong fragrance, after 2 full day of use my face got few red irritation bumps.

It felt very lightweight on skin with a natural glow.
I was able to get my exact shade, it lasted all day but the only downside was that it oxidized after a few hours
SO NICE ON THE SKIN!! I would purchase this immediately if it wasn‚Äôt that expensive ! It looks and feels amazing. The skincare in the formula is a huge plus.
I didn‚Äôt love this product. Maybe it was the colour but I felt it just sat on top of my skin and looked cakey. Didn‚Äôt matter what I used to apply.

This is a winner in my books. I decided to try the glow version instead of the matte and boy was I surprised.  Having combo/oily skin, I normally don‚Äôt go for the glow.  

This is so fresh and natural looking without being shiny. Smoothed over my pores and covered my broken capillaries with little product. I set it with a bit of loose powder and it looked flawless.  So far I‚Äôve worn this in the heat and it‚Äôs held up amazingly, lasting about 9 hours.  No oxidation, limited settling in my smile lines (let‚Äôs be honest‚Ä¶what foundation doesn‚Äôt) and no greasy mess at the end of the day.  Overall, a great foundation!

This foundation is the best thing i have ever tried in my life. I can‚Äôt even find the words to explain how this foundation felt soo lightweight on my skin, but at the same time demonstrated an insane amount of coverage!! you must get this foundation it will work for any kind of event, as it can give you the coverage you want for an event, but can also be lightweight and hydrating for every day useinsane a
Received a sample of this, the foundation goes on nicely, but it wouldnt stay until I set with loose pouder.  It also makes my pores more obvious.  Not for me.

This foundation is the best. I was always hesitant to wear foundation because I have oily skin and no foundation has ever worked.  Dior did it right. This applies so well and makes my skin look so bright and glowy. Hydrates perfectly. This is the only foundation I will wear.

The absolute BEST foundation I have ever used (and I have tried everything from Chanel to Armani, Haus Labs, Nars, Chantecaille etc). Perfectly matched. Fab consistency, goes on so well. Hydrating. Like second skin. Would buy 100 times over.

I get this product instore sephora. I tried their free sample come with my orders . I went to store. I tried on my face. It really blends properly with fingers, had a beautiful glow, hydrating base. I am really happy.

This is just like I‚Äôm using a foundation with moisturizer 
It‚Äôs dewy and nice 
Medium coverage I enjoy this product
The perfect foundation üòç i will never reconsider changing my foundation. Gives you a natural, clean look. Stays all day. Absolutely recommending!

I love the colour . Blends perfectly with my skin tone . I love the final look , it covers enough and leave a glowy natural finish . I can notice the difference . Sometime I put my foundation and 
away from the bathroom and the. I am like wow I have a beautiful skin
I went looking for a foundation I could wear for my wedding day and this is it! I love the way it smells, and it gives a nice glow to my combination skin without getting too oily.

I absolutely love this foundation. It is my go-to and I use it every time I‚Äôm doing my makeup. The finish and glow this gives you is magnificent. I bought this in the shade 1N and it makes my skin look amazing. Definitely recommend this if you are looking for the perfect glow!!

I am a Dior girl. From skin care to makeup. I was using backstage face and body but lately I felt dry. Then this beautiful product came out. I hoped that it would live up to my expectations and it definitely did. It is absolutely beautiful that you can just wear a thin layer and it will look just like perfect natural skin
Honestly amazing! Covers just perfect, lasts all day, lightweight and breathable. Definitely my go too and will not be using anything else!

This is good for people with dry to combination skin  and gives very smooth texture.
Lightweight and not at all cakey.
Good for daily wear.
Light and looks like skin. I love the finish and glowy look once applied. However if you don‚Äôt like fragrance, I‚Äôd avoid this because it does have a strong floral scent
Is not full coverage but my skin looks pretty healthy and glowing which I really liked, I was using Clinique but my skin was looking dry

Very disappointed that I had to return this product given it's great reviews. Went on really nicely, perfectly matched my skin colour, and didn't have any strong fragrance smell. However, after a mere 3 hours it started to flake off and turned my face and neck yellow, even after experimenting with numerous different products used before applying (primers, moisturizers, etc).
despite being labelled as glowy, it dries down matte on my skin, and clings to dry patches. looks very pretty in the first hour, but careful if you have dry skin!!
Flawless
full coverage
Many foundations leave a cakey presence and dry out my skin. This one blends beautifully and you only need a very small amount !

I wanted to try this a few times before giving my final thoughts. Im a healthcare worker who regularly works 12 hour shifts. That being said, I have tried & tested SO many foundations this year. My issue with other foundations is the fact that it doesnt last through a shift. I was always dealing with creasing, patching, flaking and just looking cakey. I tried different skin prep, primers, setting powders/ sprays and nothing changed. Ive been wanting to try this foundation now for a while and finally did.. and let me tell you- this is the best purchase ive ever made. It holds up beautifully, and it still looks just as amazing at the end of the day. Every issue ive had with other foundations, never happened with this. 
I have very sensitive & acne prone skin and this has not given me any sort of reaction or break out. My first shift wearing it, i received so many compliments. It gave me my confidence back! I will continue to repurchase this.

I dont have sensitive skin. I never broke out from a cosmetic product and this immediately caused the worst reaction on my face. My skin was dry itch and peeling. This foundation has a fragrance in it and it is not good for the skin. Sucks because i really liked the product.

I bought this for my mom. She loved it so much that I had to buy one for myself. The coverage is outstanding. We have been using it for a bit now, this is her 4th bottle and my 1st. Will definitely buy again!
This foundation leaves a beautiful dewy finish in my over 50 skin!!
Dior doesn't disappoint.  Even better layered. Do the coverage that works for you.  Lasts all day perfectly.
Too expensive. I wear it everyday.
Received my order today from Ulta, and it's already expired. Will buy directly from Dior from now on. Do better, Ulta.

I have rosacea and little bumps on my cheeks due to my rosacea. I pump 3 full pumps on the back of my hand, apply it to my face with a foundation brush, and I'm done. The finish is absolutely gorgeous, especially when pairing it with Huda Beauty's Cherry loose setting powder under my eyes, my nose, above my lip, and my chin. It's necessary for me to find a good foundation and a good powder because I live in Phoenix, AZ. As soon as I step outside, the heat beats down on me. The SPF in this foundation is obviously not enough, so first I moisturize with Pond's, put a 60+ SPF sunscreen cream on, Power Grip primer, then my foundation. My foundation has never looked so good! I don't care what anyone else says, but I love the scent of the foundation. I feel so pretty and luxe when applying it and smelling it. I'm on my second bottle and I will definitely be purchasing it again as it is my new regular foundation. I only hope that maybe Dior considers adding more SPF to it, but not if it changes the current formula.
My favorite foundation I mix it with elf halo glow. It's the best foundation I've used
This has so far been the best foundation I have found for my mature skin. I am so far happy with it. I am a week in and still happy!!
The finish was very greasy and blotchy. I tried with several different applicators and primers. I have textured, dry skin. Would probably look great as light coverage on clear skin!
This is my go to foundation. Absolutely love the color match and the sustainability of the product.
I love this foundation but the smell is outrageous! I cannot take it. I smelled it for a couple of hours. I never write reviews .

It feels great, and initially goes on great. I always use the Porefessional primer w/ any foundation.. then a sheer setting powder. Well my normal 2 foundations look great all day, pores look normal. The Dior lasted a couple hours before creeping all in my pores- making them stand out too much. Don't recommend if u have somewhat large pores.. mine r like medium craters w/ no makeup- lol

I have been using this for over 2 years now and love the dewy look and that it's buildable. Blush, powder, and concealer goes over it perfectly. It does oxidize and has an odd smell though. To me it doesn't smell like fragrance, but more like a chemical smell such as alcohol. For the price point, I think I will be researching alternatives.

Inloce a foubdation that guves a natural finish (not too matte, not shiny) and a bit of a "radiant" look with lightvreflecting sheen (but not some ghastly psychedelic prism effect). 

Based in thecdescriotion, inhooed this fitvthe above. It dies not. It keaves a shiny finish that is a bit "sticky" to the touch. I dud not care for it. I have nornal skin, perhaps occasionally (winter) on the dry side.

I have tried working with this product in sooo many ways and no matter what it becomes textural, dry, and patchy. Its just plain ugly. Ive never experienced anything like it. I also never leave reviews but after many months of trial and disappointment, I felt compelled to tell you to save your money. Love Dior generally good grief

A makeup artist applied this shade and it looked identical to my Cool tone pale skin. I was given a sample and used it at home. The color faded and turned out whiter than my skin tone. Half of my face was white and the other side was my natural pale skin with rosacea. Applied to entire face and I see streaks on my cheeks and it doesn't set well with Setting spray. I wanted to love this but its not giving me a natural dewy finish or the same color match. Too white!

This is actually the worst foundation I've ever used. I don't understand any positive reviews?? Cakey, oxidized, and hard to wash off. My skin looked more even and glowy before I put this junk on. Dior should stick to making handbags.
Best foundation ever.
The foundation goes on smoothly it gives a natural finish but gets so freaking blotchy and basically disappears when wearing after an hour or two not worth the price

Seriously. OMG. Sometimes, makeup just needs to be makeup. As a sensitive skin, highly acne-prone girly, I am so frustrated by the trend lately where every. single. foundation. has to somehow be infused with hyaluronic acid, or some other on-trend ingredient.

Reliable formulas I've loved for years, some for more or less a decade, I now have to abandon because they reformulate, which leads to one or more of the following effects:

1) The makeup just sucks. It oxidizes, or comes out of the tube darker or some other tone than it used to, and generally doesn't match what it used to. 

2) It breaks you out. A makeup that used to be the HG for breakout-prone girlies is now part of the problem because they force "skincare" into the formula. So those of us who spent years hunting and came to rely on a foundation now have to abandon it and are shunned as loyal customers. 

3) It separates. More often than not, the "skincare" being blindly mixed into these foundations is not meant to mix with the types of formulas in the makeup. So you end up with a foundation that ends up separating on your face and looking disgusting, whereas the original formula used to last an entire day, .

I am so deeply disappointed and frustrated with the makeup industry lately. I can barely find a single cosmetic that doesn‚Äôt tout some ‚Äúskin saving‚Äù ingredient anymore, and all I want is a simple foundation and concealer. I‚Äôm not interested in paying more for makeup that doesn‚Äôt even work half as well as it used to.

Please please PLEASE go back to just letting makeup be makeup, and skincare be skincare.

I heard so many amazing things about this foundation. It was constantly recommended to me at cosmetics stores. Alas, none of the fair tones matched my skin. My old favorite foundation was discontinued (yet again), so on my most recent search for a new one, I discovered this new Yulong shade. A different fair neutral from NARS. I tested it on my neck and was amazed by the color match. I immediately purchased it and I have used it ever since. The finish is beautiful. It's not too heavy on my sensitive skin, has the perfect buildable light-medium coverage, and lasts all day. It sets nicely on top of my Natasha Denona primer and stays with the now obsolete UD setting spray. All of my other products- mostly powder, some liquid and cream blushes- blend nicely into it without my base breaking or fading. I truly cannot see myself ever switching to another foundation as long as this formula stays the same and this shade remains in stock. I have the hardest time color matching and my shade seems to get discontinued often on other product lines, so I worry this shade won't be popular enough to keep around but fingers crossed. For reference, I'm a 125 Fenty and a 0N Dior.

Its not just a light smell either its very strong and pungent.

I do get hormonal breakouts at times (I'm 53), but not THAT bad, I really think this made my skin break out. And the match quiz did not help me, Valarius is too orange for me. Pretty disappointing and a waste of quite a few dollars.

I've spent over 25 years wearing EsteeLauder, converted to Revlon to break up costs and to get a tad more moisture as I age.  EL I'm Cashew color.  I was matched up Barcelona (which was too light for me) or Valencia (which was too orange for me). Revlon I have to buy 2 colors to mix.  Nars, well I love their blushes.  Their foundation seemed to be loved by many,  so I thought I'd try out of boredom.... first off, when I say it's runny,  I mean,  you literally need a drop. its almost like I dumped an entire bottle of serum into my foundation.  Yes,  that's how runny it is,  even when rubbing into my face.  I looked like a wet wax face.  It felt uncomfortable like I wanted to itch it off. Even with a setting powder it was wet.  Other makeup did NOT blend well at all either. Side note,  I have PCOS, so I need full coverage.  This is probably the furthest from medium/full/build able coverage.  So it's a huge no for me.  Not only that,  during the day I kept getting a wiff of something rancid on my face.  I have sensitive skin. Made where I shave,  turn red and seap through.  I'll stick with what I use.  Love Nars, but not the foundation.  Probably perfect for people who want a BB cream lol

I wore this foundation for a full day to do a wear test and see how the product looked from running around all day... I'll give it a 7/10.

I‚Äôm honestly so sad to be writing this review because Est√©e Lauder Double Wear has been my holy grail foundation for the last 10 years. It was my go-to for a flawless, long-lasting finish, and I always loved how it could keep my skin looking matte and perfect all day without budging. But recently, it seems like their formula changed. It‚Äôs patchy, cakey, and just doesn‚Äôt sit well on my skin anymore. No matter how I apply it, whether with a brush or sponge, it starts to look uneven and accentuates texture, something I never had issues with before. It‚Äôs such a shame because for years this was the perfect foundation for me, and now I can‚Äôt even wear it without feeling like it‚Äôs making my skin look worse. Holy Grail! So, I was a Smashbox, Studio Skin 24 Hour Wear Hydrating Foundation girlie for YEARS and then the very unfortunate day came where they discontinued it. I was smart and stock pile bought several bottles to keep me going for at least a year and a half to hold me over until I could search for something that was just as good. I knew it would be a VERY daunting journey because lets face it, Smashbox Studio Skin was literal perfection. Fast forward to now. Just started on my last bottle of Smashbox Studio Skin and unfortunately know the time has come to start my search for what is an irreplaceable product. I've tried Milk, Yensa, and other foundations up to this point and honey, it's a no for me. I'm 38. Very minimal lines and no wrinkles (thank God) for now however, those lines and laugh lines that happen through out the day around the brow and eyes can look worse with makeup on than they do without makeup. My biggest hurdle with foundations was the creasing and the often times, icky damp feeling that I would get after 8 hours of wear. I went to Sephora to get samples of a few foundations I had been eyeing. They didn't have those foundations at that store however, they talked me into trying this Estee Lauder Double Wear. For the record I would have NEVER even thought to try this due to some of the reviews so, I was like sure, it's a free sample, why not try it. THIS IS IT. My flabbers are GASTED. I wore this on a Saturday just in case it made me look gross throughout the day and honey, it survived an all day session of painting our house, physically intense house work with near ZERO creasing and kept me matte and honestly looking like I just put on a fresh face of makeup even though I had been wearing it for over 10 hours. I AM FLOORED. I will say, it is a bit drier that I'm used too however, I will take it. Finally a foundation that does not make me look 50 years old after 8 hours of wear. It does not easily transfer and is incredibly lite on the skin.

This is my first bottle of the Double Wear, after using the Double Wear Sheer for several years.  Overall, I preferred the sheer, but it's been discontinued, so here we are.  Things I like:  I do love that the colors are the same across both foundations, and that they really ARE the same.  I kept my same color, and it's just as good as it always was.  Things that I don't love:  (a) this is not as smooth and easy to spread as the Double Wear Sheer was.  It's workable, but not nearly as easy to apply; (b) I do not like the glass bottle at all.  The plastic squeeze bottle was easier to manage, easier to dispense the product, and easier to travel with.  Also, unbreakable ~ a bonus in the bathroom where many of us apply makeup.  The glass bottle doesn't lend itself to easy application with a brush, a sponge, your fingers....nothing really.  Overall, it's workable, and I'm not likely to change.  But I do question why those of us who used the Double Wear Sheer are forced to convert to the heavier Double Wear, or change product lines/manufacturers altogether.

The formula is creamy and easy to apply. The applicator is a large doe foot that holds a fair amount of product. The product dries down to be matte and has a skin like finish. It blends out well into my makeup and is comfortable on my skin. I was satisfied with the longevity of the coverage but can't say for certain if it lasts 24 hours as I don't wear makeup that long‚Ä¶

I will say since it has a natural matte finish, it was important that I really hydrated my skin prior to applying this concealer. If I didn't it would settle a bit more into the lines on my face. Not a huge deal for me as most concealers perform much better with a fully prepped face.

The shelf life is 6 months. This gives me a bit of pause as I am not sure I can finish this all in 6 months. It would be great to have a mini one that's also half the price. 

I'd recommend this if you can find the perfect shade match as I really enjoy the formula!

This is the absolute BEST foundation every. I have tried so many that clog my pores, make me look cakes, transfer or doesn't last but not this one. It gives great coverage, perfect for my oily skin. I do not have the wrinkles or age spots that a lot of my friends the same age have.  My daughter tells me all the time, mom, you have not aged!  I believe this is directly because I have used Double Wear to protect my skin for so many years.  I have tried other brands, but not for long.  I always come back to Estee Lauder.

I've been using this foundation for almost 20 years. It has gone through at least 3 noticeable formula changes in that time. It started out as a thick, opaque, full coverage, everything-proof foundation and is now a mediocre, medium-at-best coverage, normal liquid foundation. The last two bottles I bought have oxidized in the bottle within 6-8 months, even when used with a pump immediately upon opening (so it is not exposed by the bottle opening) and being kept in a drawer. That alone will keep me from buying another. I also get oily after a few hours, even with proper prep and set. It oxidizes on my face over the course of the day and wipes off in places easily, so it looks patchy at various times as well. This just isn't the best on the market anymore and the price point is absurd for the lesser quality. I appreciate that it never causes issues for my acne prone skin and that it doesn't have a scent. The shades run very peachy and there is not a true olive shade (once it dries down and/or changes color over the day). There used to be 2 great olive shades I could wear before the last reformulation. I haven't found a proper shade since, and resorted to using a color corrector bc I thought I liked the formula. No more.

I have never found a better shade match and felt so happy the day I found my shade. I love the coverage and always end up using too much because it doesn't have a pump. I have seen pumps for this on the internet and must remember to get one. You have to shake this formula to get the best out of it. It does last a really long time and it doesn't break apart. I think it's supposed to be a medium coverage and you are supposed to see your skin/freckels underneath it. I was trying to cover redness and used too much of this.
I think I used too much powder and too much foundation because I stopped using this after a few bad days with my makeup looking to heavy. I liked it better when I really prepped my skin with moisturizer and primer. If you have dryness and texture problems they can get magnified by the dry down of this formula. It's a super long lasting formula and is supposed to dry down, so it accomplishes that well. I didn't have a dewy setting spray at the time so I used what I had but I think it looks better after it's been worn for two hours or so. I think you need to be better than a beginner to use this. It needs the right supporting products to go with it. A setting spray that softens it, something like a primer to save the texture/pores you see, the right powder, and the nearly 60 shades to choose from makes it kind of tricky to use.
I tried it out because I got it on sale but I think I prefer others over this. I'm just getting back into makeup and need something a little more forgiving .

Armani's luminous silk not only matched well, but it also has an appropriate amount of coverage.

Now, I just need to wait for it to be back in stock.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: I started using this in 2023 and changed to a different brand in February 2024, I forgot why since my makeup looked good in a lot of photos, so i repurchased it recently,worst mistake! Right off the bat after ONE day of using it again, my skin immediately breaks out horribly. This was the only new product in my routine. I thought maybe it was just stress hormones or acne, but after the 4th day i stopped immediately as it just kept getting worse and worse.  A week later, my skin was 90% clear!  Also, throughout the 4 days i realized my makeup was very patchy and cracked after a couple of hours and VERY noticeable in person! i hydrated my skin a lot thinking it would solve the issue, but it still kept creasing. Lastly, it oxidizes almost immediately. If it didn‚Äôt oxidize as soon it made contact with skin, then it 1000% will after setting powder. i changed setting powders, moisturizer, techniques but all these issues were consistent. Sadly, i threw out the packaging of the foundation so now it‚Äôs just collecting disht lol. The main take away is if you‚Äôre into oxidized, cracked, creased makeup with a side of extreme acne then this is the foundation for yo! :)

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This foundation feels so good on my skin. I put it on after allowing my moisturizer to dry and I was so surprised how well it blended into my skin since I never have good results with foundation matching. But Lancome said we got you! They have a diverse range of shades and coverage to match my darker skin. This gave me such smooth effortless coverage, I didn‚Äôt need any blending, any powder, any blush ‚Äì nothing else. I put this foundation on in the morning and wear it all day, it stays looking effortless all day. It has a light scent that fades once it dries and the product dries quickly. I also love that sunscreen is also right in the product, so I don‚Äôt have to apply a separate sunscreen before applying foundation and then risking my skin feeling oily or sweaty in the Southern heat. Best of all, this foundation is well-suited to all day wear, it minimizes my pores and causes no irritation. Even though I wore this foundation on days when it has been over 100 degrees Fahrenheit, the product has not sweated off. I have even accidentally fallen asleep with it on and had to get up and wash it off in the middle of the night, and still my skin was smooth and breakout free.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text:
I used to religiously swear by Teint Idole. It was essentially my holy grail foundation. Very full coverage without being too cakey. So naturally, when I saw this new formulation, I figured it was an improvement. I was incredibly wrong.
As soon as you apply it to your hand to put it on your brush, you notice how loose it is. Almost immediately after applying it to my skin, it had started to oxidize and look patchy near my hairline. It was settled so much into the lines on my forehead, I swear I look better without makeup. 
I actually reached out to Sephora to ask for an exchange or store credit as I'm so disappointed in this product, and despite being a Rouge, they sent me to Lancome to complain.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text:
[I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This is truly a great foundation! One of the standout features for me is how weightless it feels on the skin, it‚Äôs like wearing nothing, but with great medium to full build able coverage. The semi-matte finish is beautiful and looks so natural and smooth. 

I have oily skin so I wore it with the Hourglass Veil primer and was impressed with how well it held up throughout the day. Even when my natural oils started to come through in the evening, it didn‚Äôt look greasy at all. Instead, it gave my skin a subtle dewy glow that looked fresh rather than shiny.

The only downside I noticed is with the shade range or the accuracy of the shades. When I first received it, I thought the color would be way too dark 345N , but it turned out to be a perfect summer match. Typically I would have picked a color in the 200N range considering I fall in the light skin tone range. To be honest, even for a summer shade I would have never gotten 345N which is for medium skin tone, assuming it would be far too dark. Usually for my summer shade I get a light medium shade. If I had picked it out myself based on what I usually go for, I probably would‚Äôve ended up with something way too light. So definitely try it in person if you can. All in all, I absolutely love this foundation and will be purchasing it myself once I finish this bottle.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: Although it is full coverage, it clings to dry patches and almost curls up from the skin even with lots of eye prep. I‚Äôd recommend it for someone with more oily skin than dry for sure even though it‚Äôs a fan favorite, it sadly just didn‚Äôt work out for me (being a person with really dry under eyes)

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: I thought Est√©e Lauder was the top tier unbeatable foundation, & while it was‚Ä¶ it doesn‚Äôt compete with Lanc√¥me w/ a full face beat. I adore this foundation so much, face has an extra umph to it when I‚Äôm wearing it

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: Foundation doesn‚Äôt last long when you have oily skin. It says you have to reapply every 2 hours. Not worth the money. To me this is more of a foundation if you‚Äôre going to the beach and want to be applying it is spf.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: Love how easily this foundation is to apply and to build to a light or higher coverage. I have combination skin. My skin felt balanced and the product did not crease or look greasy. My makeup held well for hours long after I applied it. The coverage was uniform and natural.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: Excellent finish, easy to blend, texture is smooth, buildable coverage, good shade range.  Packaging is sleek and the Lanc√¥me brand has always been one to rely on.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: This was my first Lancome foundation product so I was super excited to receive. The color was slightly lighter than I needed, but i was able to work with it. The packaging was nice, as you would expect with a prestige foundation. The texture was thinner than most foundations I've used, but felt nice going on. The longevity was good, but I felt it looked better in the beginning than after a full day of wear. I've used many foundations so I wouldn't probably purchase this one when other lesser priced formulas perform as good or better.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: This reformulation is a joke. I went to rebuy 90N and it is literally the same color as my old 110C! I thought I grabbed the wrong bottle but NOPE, this "new" shade is way darker than it used to be. Shame on Lancome for not offering truly fair shades anymore. It also seems a little thinner even with shaking and not quite the same coverage level, maybe medium.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation

This was very disappointing as it was labeled as a cool toned shade.

review_text: Wow, I was really impressed with this foundation. It gave me a smooth finish with full coverage; yet, it didn't feel heavy nor did it creases into my fine wrinkles.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This foundation feels so good on my skin. I put it on after allowing my moisturizer to dry and I was so surprised how well it blended into my skin since I never have good results with foundation matching. But Lancome said we got you! They have a diverse range of shades and coverage to match my darker skin. This gave me such smooth effortless coverage, I didn't need any blending, any powder, any blush ‚Äì nothing else. I put this foundation on in the morning and wear it all day, it stays looking effortless all day. It has a light scent that fades once it dries and the product dries quickly. I also love that sunscreen is also right in the product, so I don't have to apply a separate sunscreen before applying foundation and then risking my skin feeling oily or sweaty in the Southern heat. Best of all, this foundation is well-suited to all day wear, it minimizes my pores and causes no irritation. Even though I wore this foundation on days when it has been over 100 degrees Fahrenheit, the product has not sweated off. I have even accidentally fallen asleep with it on and had to get up and wash it off in the middle of the night, and still my skin was smooth and breakout free.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: As I have gotten older, my foundation needs have changed.  I have tried other brands, but keep coming back to this one.  It goes on smooth, the color match is phenomenal, and the sunscreen is necessary for a foundation product.  I want a dewy product that does not end up looking cakey and this one delivers.  It's a little pricey, but worth it.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: Love the coverage and feel of my skin with this foundation

Lasted great through a 5 hour round of golf, in very warm and somewhat humid weather.  I'm so glad I found the perfect match for my skin and its needs.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: I've been an incredibly loyal wearer of this foundation for about a decade. The main reason for my loyalty has been my super pale skin. 90N of this foundation has historically been the only foundation available without special ordering that matches my skin and doesn't cause other problems. It is also been very longlasting. But in the last year or so they have CHANGED the color of 90N. I was hoping it was fluke, but its not. It is now too dark/orange for my skin. And there's no shade that's lighter.  Off to hunt for a new full coverage option for the days that's what I want. SHAME on you Lancome for changing an enduring and pretty perfect product. And shame for not providing shades for all skin tones anymore. We're not all olive skinned. I'd add photos to back this review up but I'm not seeing that option.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text:
I really wanted to love this foundation, especially with all the hype around its long wear and full coverage, but it didn't quite work for my skin type. I have drier skin, and the formula felt a bit too thick. Instead of giving me a smooth finish, it emphasized every pore and clung to dry patches, even with a good primer underneath.

That said, I will give Lanc√¥me credit where it's due. The shade range is excellent. I was able to find a really solid color match, which isn't always easy. I appreciate the inclusive selection.

Overall, I think this foundation could be a great fit for someone with normal to oily skin. If you lean dry like me, you might want to proceed with caution or prep really well before applying.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text:
The girl who matched me, matched me wrong.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: New formula is not full coverage, but now "buildable". Oxidates, formula no longer fully sticks to the face. Foundation now comes off with sweat and tears within 8 hour use. Unlike the new formula, why am I still able to see my freckles and birth marks through the foundation. New formula feels like sunscreen sitting on the face. Even with 3 layers of building, it's not enough to fully cover. I used the entire bottle in hopes that every time I applied the experindcr would be different, not to mention the price of the foundation. New formula no longer upholds its intended said use.

review_text: I have FINALLY found my perfect match after going through countless brands. 350N is perfect for neutral olives. review_text: I don't typically write reviews for products, but this one warranted the post. review_text: This will be my third time trying to get this foundation from ulta. The last 2 bottles that I received have both been expired!! review_text:

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text:
[I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This is truly a great foundation! One of the standout features for me is how weightless it feels on the skin, it's like wearing nothing, but with great medium to full build able coverage. The semi-matte finish is beautiful and looks so natural and smooth. 

I have oily skin so I wore it with the Hourglass Veil primer and was impressed with how well it held up throughout the day. Even when my natural oils started to come through in the evening, it didn't look greasy at all. Instead, it gave my skin a subtle dewy glow that looked fresh rather than shiny.

The only downside I noticed is with the shade range or the accuracy of the shades. When I first received it, I thought the color would be way too dark 345N , but it turned out to be a perfect summer match. Typically I would have picked a color in the 200N range considering I fall in the light skin tone range. To be honest, even for a summer shade I would have never gotten 345N which is for medium skin tone, assuming it would be far too dark. Usually for my summer shade I get a light medium shade. If I had picked it out myself based on what I usually go for, I probably would've ended up with something way too light. So definitely try it in person if you can. All in all, I absolutely love this foundation and will be purchasing it myself once I finish this bottle.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: Found the perfect warm tone shade! Very easy to blend and very buildable! Super hydrating not too heavy, would highly recommend as a go to natural look foundation.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This was a surprisingly lovely foundation. I loved the finish on my skin. I would describe it as a medium coverage foundation. product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: I originally bought thry estee lauder double wear and it sucked so bad. It wasn't blending well with my skin. By far this is WAAYYY better than ELDW in my opinion and a few little pumps of this and blending it out with a sponge is just enough. People say that it does oxidize, I think it does a bit so just be sure to get a lighter shade. The coverage is amazing it covers most of my acne scarring and redness so I don't need to go in with too much concealer.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: In all my seaons (pale winter, bronzed summer) I keep coming back to this foundation. It doesnt break me out, its like a second skin and looks beautiful on my oily, acne prone skin. HOWEVER, this does oxidize and it gets worse the lighter the shade. I thought I was going crazy wondering why my neck was starting to not match my face by the time I'd finish doing my makeup. I had to get a second opinion to comfirm. So while 135 is my shade, it oxidizes 2 shades darker. I had to go down to 115 and then THAT will oxidize into my actual shade. What the heck Lanc√¥me??? You're $53+, start acting like it.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text:
I absolutely love the Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation! This foundation feels very lightweight on the skin but gives amazing coverage. It evens out my skin tone, hides redness, and covers any little blemishes without looking heavy. One of the best things about this foundation is how long it lasts. I put it on in the morning, and it still looks fresh by the evening without needing to touch it up. Even on hot days, it doesn't slide off or fade. It also has a natural matte finish that looks smooth but not dry, so my skin looks polished but not shiny.

It's very easy to apply, whether I use a brush, sponge, or even my fingers. I just need a small amount to cover my whole face, so the bottle lasts a long time, which makes it worth the price. The color range is fantastic, so it's easy to find a perfect match for my skin tone. Overall, I highly recommend the Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation if you want a long-lasting, full-coverage foundation that still feels light and natural. It's perfect for everyday use and even special occasions.

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: I love this foundation from Lancome !!! It last long all day. I love how easy it blends on my skin and very lightweight. This foundation brings a smooth and medium coverage,  not too thick which I love the most. But if you have a dry skin, should put on moisturizer really well before use this foundation or it will dry out your skin after. Overall, I really like this Foundation and it will be my Favorite One. Highly recommend!!!

product_name: Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Ultra Wear Foundation
review_text: I think this foundation is a pretty great option for people looking for something that won't look different every day. Whether my skin was more dry or more oily that day, it still had the same finish and had similar lasting power. This is foundation, and looks as such, so don't expect it to look like a BB cream or a tinted sunscreen, but it definitely does it's job. As with all my other experiences with foundation, it does settle into pores a little bit and will emphasize your texture if it is particularly visible. It has great coverage and doesn't look cakey as long as you don't apply too much -- a little goes a long way! I found blending it out with a damp sponge was my favorite way to apply this foundation.

Lancome teint idole ultra wear foundation

review_text:
I normally wear a skin tint since I can't stand the heavy feeling of a foundation or the make-up'y look of it. I was pleasantly surprised that I can get medium coverage and long wear with Lancome Teint Idole Ultra Wear foundation without any of the negatives, so thank you Bzz Agent for the free product. I wore it to a dance class and it stayed and kept my face natural rather than shiny looking through it as well as several hours later without touchups. Love the beautiful glass bottle, which feels solid and looks great on my bathroom countertop. Pump works well, too, and doesn't spew out too much product. 

It did make my pores look more noticeable, which is why I gave this foundation 4 and not 5 stars, so a good primer and skin prep are essential before using it. For reference, I have normal to slightly dry aging olive light medium skin with neutral undertones and 330N was a near perfect match for me.

review_text: I am a huge fan of Nars soft matte, it‚Äôs long been my holy grail and I love full coverage foundations. It is full coverage but blends beautifully, it layers well and works with every product I‚Äôve put over or under it. Once it‚Äôs set with powder it‚Äôs extremely resilient to any conditions. It‚Äôs got more of a skin like finish than the Nars I‚Äôd say and requires less of a skin prep regimen if you have dry skin. The shade range is excellent, too. I had to wear this foundation a few times before I decided I really love it, but it‚Äôs become one of my most reached for foundations. Fenty did a great job! Nars looks better in photos and on camera but in real life I‚Äôd say this foundation is the best for a fuller coverage look!

review_text: I was sadly kind of underwhelmed by this. It goes on shockingly light but when it oxidizes it dries down to nearly a perfect match for my skin, but it's orange-y, which is typical for me. My undertone is very pink, and even now that many lines are carrying foundations in my shade range it's still really difficult to find something that isn't neutral/warm leaning. Since I bought this ages ago I also started using adapalene and I don't think there's any way I could use this without drying the heck out of my already-dry face. I think the formula is great if it works for your skin, and you test out the shade beforehand in-store, but if you are looking for a very light foundation with a genuinely cool undertone this isn't it.

review_text: I was discouraged when the color match recommendation option on here gave me three VERY different colors based off of the other foundations I use, then when I trued all three and none matched me. It went on so smooth, gave an absolutely beautiful finish, and the coverage was nice with just one coat but was buildable to give a more full effect. And it LASTED! I wore it outside in pouring rain for 8+ hours working a renaissance faire and it didn't budge! I can't tell you how obsessed I am with it, honestly. I got it during 21 Days of Beauty at half off but will 100% pay full price in the future (and stock up any time I see it on sale again!).

I tried everything to attempt to like this foundation since it had such good reviews but it isnt good for anyone who has dry or acne prone skin at all. Trying to cover acne is near impossible when it just comes off with every layer you try to build. It looks dry and patchy on moisturized skin. Even after the first application i noticed some break outs and soon after that it gave me the largest pimples ive had in years. My skin is clogged and feels/looks terrible after using this. I tried to like it so bad but after a few weeks of attempting to wear it i can say it's absolutely not good. Returned and went right back to Nars.

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: This foundation is absolutely horrible. I tried everything to attempt to like this foundation since it had such good reviews but it isnt good for anyone who has dry or acne prone skin at all. Trying to cover acne is near impossible when it just comes off with every layer you try to build. It looks dry and patchy on moisturized skin. Even after the first application i noticed some break outs and soon after that it gave me the largest pimples ive had in years. My skin is clogged and feels/looks terrible after using this. I tried to like it so bad but after a few weeks of attempting to wear it i can say it's absolutely not good. Returned and went right back to Nars.

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: I have used this foundation in the past and absolutely loved it, but recently my usual brand was out so I was recommended this foundation as a similar replacement. I was color matched in store and was happy with the color but as I began to regularly use this product it would look very dry and patchy on my skin. The color definitely oxidizes after it dries down another shade. I've also been very diligent with my skin care and my skin was looking better than ever but since using this product for a little over a month ive been having horrible acne breakouts even on my neck where I don't normally get acne where I would blend down the foundation. My face feels clogged and dry after using this foundation and i feel it has set back the results ive worked hard to acheive. I returned it and went right back to my usual.

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: This makeup matches, my color perfectly, and the coverage is amazing!

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: Its an amazing foundation

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: This is by far my favorite foundation. It somehow feels light on the skin and provides full coverage. A little goes a long way and the bottle lasts for quite a while. Even after wearing all day and sweating, it does not feel cakey and heavy. I definitely recommend!

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: I use with a moist sponge for a beautiful dewey finish.

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: Since I was 16, every 6 weeks I bought a different brands lightest shade that was always supposedly neutral pale tone. Until I spent the money to get a nice foundation, Everytime I was always much too tan or pink. Almost like a rocket pop of different colors. Now at 24 I will never go cheap on foundation again, and as long as my shade remains I'll only buy Fenty since it lasts for several months. If you're thinking about getting it, trust me it's worth your money.

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: It oxidizes so bad, totally different from initial finish look

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: This foundation is so amazing. I was looking for a full coverage/matte foundation that didnt feel thick and uncomfortable throughout the day and Rhiana pulled through with this one. It blends so beautifully with other liquid and powder products and lasts through long days. It smooths out my skin soooo well. I would defiently recomment this foundation if you want a foindation that doesnt feel heavy and uncomfortable throughout the day, makes you skin look smooth and gorgeous, blends soooo well with other products, lasts a long time, and is decently affordable but high end and good quality.

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: For some reason this is the only foundation thay will not blend into my skin it just slides. Even with the correct primer it just blotches and sits. Its so strange because no other has done this. I want to love it, the coverage is great just not how it sits.

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: I bought this concealer because of the good reviews. It looked really good after first applying it with a sponge after two hours. It's coming off all over my face and looks like it's caked on. I wasted my money and I will not buy again.

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text:
I have been using this product for a couple of years now, since 2023
I love how it covers my skin imperfections 
It is smooth 
Not caky at all

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: The coverage is so so good, the shade range is huge and its acne safe (for my skin).

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: This kind of sat in my pores and creases. I returned it

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text:
this is my go to foundation for less intense makeup looks. i wear a lot of bold goth makeup, but when i dont want to do
that, this is a good foundation. it has good coverage (though i tend to have pretty clear skin). i can barely feel it on my skin honestly. overall very good product!

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: Loved it!

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: This was drying so fast on my face that i couldn't even blend it at all.

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: Decided to try this foundation as I've been doing the tinted moisturizers for some time. This foundation is amazing. Leaves my skin looking flawless. Better yet, I don't need a loose powder over it! Got a lot of compliments!

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: I love this foundation and have used it foe years. Why did yall get rid of shade 105! It was my perfect shade!!! None others come close

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: I've been buying this product for some time now and all of a sudden the last 2 that have dropped  broke and that had never happened before when accidentally dropped.

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: I used to love this product a lot. But I am not sure if they have changed the formula. It is not the same as it used to be.

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: Great foundation with decent coverage but yet still a light foundation that doesn't feel cakey. Definitely recommend trying if you are looking for a new foundation!

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: Love it

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: The finish on this foundation is matte and last on my skin throughout the day depending on what powder I use after and with proper skin preparation. It does dry down fast so blending quickly is crucial. The packaging is sleek, clean, and nice compared to drugstore foundations. I would buy this foundation again and recommend it to those with oily skin types looking for a matte foundation.

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: MUA here to tell you to please swatch this formula and let it dry for 10 minutes before purchasing and watch how the color changes before purchasing to make sure it still works for you.  It will continue to get darker as well as warm up.   This product works best for people with strong warm / golden undertones who want full coverage. If you have neutral or cool / pink / red undertones, dry skin, sensitive skin, or foundation easily turns you orange, this may not be for you. Please see a beauty advisor in store for this one, folks.

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: Love this foundation, it stays on all day and doesn't come off on my clothes.

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: This foundation comes out the tube so thin, it doesn't cover anything. Then throughout the day it fades away and clings to imperfections on your face.

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: Goes on light and about 90% full coverage. I'm new to trying a matte finish, and not sure of I'm a fan but I love that it's long lasting. The color is nice and consistent with my face.

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: Seperates

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: Seperates

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: I am 42 and my skin is oily. I've tried all the best foundations and this one is the most blurring I've used and makes me look 10 years younger. I used il makiage primer underneath and it really makes my skin flawless!

product_name: Fenty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte Foundation
review_text: I accidentally bought this instead of the luminous one. After 4 hours the foundation was patchy. I used Smashbox Photo Finish primer and Urban Decay All Nighter Setting Spray. My skin is normal, not dry or oily. I dermaplane religiously and my skin is smooth. Im really disappointed. I hope the luminous one is better because im exchanging it tomorrow.
